Reviews.Title: “No, thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Nellieat4
Reviews.Content: We will not be returning to Hotel Victoria. The location was nice but there are plenty of hotels in the area. Fortunately we had unseasonably warm weather so the 10 minute walk to the parking garage was pleasant or I know I would have been grumpy by the time I got back. The staff was professional but certainly not friendly. We appreciate coffee as soon as we wake up and the single- serve pot was ridiculous. We were only give one pouch of regular coffee and our request for more the following day was ignored. That in itself is enough to send me elsewhere. Dealing with our luggage at the end of our stay was frustrating. We both left knowing that we would not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find Near Almost Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Hildetoronto
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled when I won a free night at this wonderful downtown Toronto hotel. I was somewhat familiar with the historic Hotel Victoria since I've stayed a few times before. I phoned to book a date and was dealt with by Peter. He was friendly and welcoming. I knew about the lack of onsite parking and did not require a car since the location is so central and convenient. It is a short walking distance from Union Station and many attractions. I am 62, so when I say walking distance, I mean it. There is parking nearby if needed. My daughter and I arrived at 2 p.m., too early for check in, and wanted to store our bags so that we could shop. The wonderful desk clerk, Erskine, told us we were welcome to go ahead and put our things into the room since it was ready. Our room was on the 5th floor, small and lovely. It was stylishly decorated, very clean and comfortable with a modern bathroom. There wasn't much of a view but didn't care since we weren't planning on spending our time in the room staring out of the window. The hotel is smoke free and smelled fresh. Because of the modest size and the historic elements of this hotel, it does not have every convenience a larger, newer facility might have, however, any potential needs are addressed in the hotel information guide found in the room. We had a question on check-in and when we returned later in the afternoon, Erskine had resolved it in a more than satisfactory manner Although there is a subway stop available near the hotel, we found the walk to the Eaton Centre for shopping to be quite short. ***Note to visitors...We discovered that "The Bay" gives a 15% discount to non-locals. We showed our Hotel Victoria key and saved quite a bit of money. There are varied dining opportunities nearby from fast food to gourmet. After a leisurely dinner, we returned to find Brian, at the front desk of the hotel. He was knowledgable and helped us with directions to a major grocery store and gave us advice about nearby entertainment. Again, all was in walking distance. In the morning, we had breakfast at the onsite restaurant "Over Easy". It's open from early morning until 3 p.m. The menu included both breakfast and lunch items and was good value for the money. We checked out and were not yet ready to go home, so we appreciated having our bags stored gratis until we were finished with our city adventures later in the day. Hotel Victoria is a terrific choice for people attending concerts, sporting events and shopping. Unlike some larger city hotels, it does not give you the feeling of being impersonal. The staff does their best to be polite, accomodating and helpful without appearing pretentious. This hotel is excellent value for the money. I wouldn't stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Small in room size, big on service and location.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugcheri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weeknight in a standard queen room to attend a concert just down the street (200m) at the Sony Centre. Reservations: Called directly and received a better rate than posted online and when I mentioned we were seeing a concert, was just directed to show my tickets at check-in for an additional 10% off the rate! Check in- No hotel parking, that was fine. We parked at an outside parking lot at Sherbourne and Front Street. $5 overnight until at 6am. (we left at 8 and it wasn't a problem) Its a 10 minute walk, but it's $5 parking downtown and we each only had a small overnight bag. Check in was fine, very friendly and professional staff, and it only took a few minutes. Room- We were in 206 (I think). The room was small, which I expected, spotless and the bed was comfy with great linen. The bathroom was fine and had everything we needed. Hot water came immediately and the towels were nice and fluffy. Although there were only two. I'm sure getting more would have been only a phone call to the desk away. There was no view, I didn't really care. This might bother some people. Good quality sleep, we heard no street noise or noises from other guests. Location- Awesome! Right in the middle of everything. Close to numerous dinner choices, and the concert theatre we were attending. I picked this hotel for this very reason. It's also close to the ACC, the subway, CN Tower, Queens Quay and Eaton Centre. Price- Not too bad, 120 with tax after the discount. IS it worth this much? I wish I could have gotten a better deal, and would have been happier if I had. So I don't think so. Overall- Reading the reviews you should be able to determine that its a small hotel that is doing its best right smack in the center of downtown Toronto. Would I stay again? Most definitely, if I were attending another concert close by. If I could get the same price on priceline et al for a 4 or 5 star? Obviously not.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Amyjess
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Victoria with my daughter and her friends for my daughter's 16th birthday. The location is great, just one block from King St. subway station or a short walk to Union Station. The lobby is bright and beautifully decorated. Check-in was fast and efficient. We were placed on the 3rd floor. The girls had a lovely delux twin Queen room with a view of Yonge St. and I had a standard Queen room across the hall with a courtyard view. Both rooms were very tastefully decorated. The beds were super comfortable. The standard room was a bit small, but it was so pretty and comfortable it didn't matter. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful, even when we forgot to turn our clocks ahead and missed check out time it was no problem. There is a nice restaurant for breakfast next door. We really enjoyed our stay here and will definitely keep it in mind for future stays in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: MitchB62
Reviews.Content: I can't believe I never knew about this hotel before. After spending years staying at big chain hotels this place is a breath of fresh air. It is a small boutique style hotel, in a prime location with reasonable rates. The rooms are small but well planned out and styled beautifully. The staff are pleasant and more than willing to help with anything you need. I stayed for 2 nites. It is walking distance from union station and lots of attractions and good restaurants. If you drive stay at the parking garage at Church and Esplanade just a 5 minute walk from the hotel. There is also a restaurant on site with great food and good prices. This is my new "go to" place in Toronto from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Luna T
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at this hotel in two different rooms. It has been recently renovated and although the quality of the materials doesn't seem great (particularly in the lobby) the rooms are really nice. My only complaint is that the heating / AC system is a bit odd: our first room was quite cold and there was no way to stop the cool "breeze". Breakfast was not included but they have a restaurant in the same building that offers a decent menu for a reasonable price. The location is fantastic, 5 min max from the train station and surrounded by several metro stations. There are plenty of restaurants, shops, and tourist attractions nearby if that's what you're there for, including of course the Hockey Hall of Fame!! But for me the best thing of this hotel me is the staff: they were so helpful and friendly!! I will definitely stay there next time I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but will Diff not Come Again”
Reviews.Author: mila c
Reviews.Content: I stay here this Saturday when I check it they said I had to pay extra $50 on person. I pre-paid for this room a month ago online and before I booked with them I called to make sure having extra people wouldnâ€™t be an issue or charge the woman on phone said it was fine. After 10 mins of fighting with manager he finally gave up and believed me so he didnâ€™t charge me. Then the manager said I didnâ€™t pay for my room, again had to fight with him to double check, Then 5 mins later finally found that I did. I ask for Champagne glasses for our room so we could drink in our room while getting ready before going out, the hotel said NO, that too many clients have broke their glasses so they wouldnâ€™t give it to us. So my friend went out and bought champagne glasses for our room before going out. I think this Hotel is Beautiful, lets of history great location, no parking so I had to park 7 mins away. Would I stay here again NO.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: gilliandkerr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights in late February. Excellent location and good value for money. 'Easy Over' the in house restaurant is really good although not open in the evening. Staff very helpful and friendly. I agree with other reviews that the rooms are smallish but I thought more than adequate. The hotel has recently had a make over but it's not the greatest of qualities although I like the style. The hotel is a little worn around the edges with damaged carpets in the halls, chipped door frames / skirting board and my shower head was not quite attached to the wall. My room heating also only had two settings - cold and very hot. There was also no safe deposit box. I would stay here again and would recomment it but it is not quite the hidden gem I was looking for although almost!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MikeCOttawa
Reviews.Content: Definitely lives up to its self-promotion on its website. This is a classic Boutique Hotel by definition, very European in nature. Under 60 rooms, the rooms are on the smaller side (which is to be expected in this style of property) but very nicely appointed and do not feel "cramped" by any stretch of the imagination. A pleasant twist was the bathroom. Usually in European-style boutique hotels the bathrooms are tiny but ours was quite spacious. All areas of the hotel were very, very clean and well maintained and the 5-6 staff members we encountered over our 2 night stay were extremely pleasant and professional. The location is perfect if you enjoy walking a city. Close to a lot of places you want to be. Note, try not to get there during rush hour traffic because at those hours you will not be able to stop in front of the hotel to drop off your luggage and check-in. This is a very small inconvenience in exchange for such a great location on Toronto's famous Yonge street. I'm not sure what the exact rush hours are, but you may want to ask when you call for reservations. In any event if that does happen you can pull-over around the block. Lastly, the price is very reasonable for this location. My wife and I will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: eddyandthecruisers
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for 11 nights. We wanted a downtown area at a reasonable price. This is often an oxymoron when it comes to Toronto. However, we were pleasantly surprised that this hotel, located at Yonge and Wellington, lived up to its website hype. Though located in a historic building built over a 100 years ago, it has been recently refurbished to a very comfortable standard. The room we were in is small by today's standard. There was just enough space for two double beds, a small stand alone closet and a table. The flat screen TV hung from the wall. The bathroom had a toilet, sink and shower. The beds were very comfy. The walls are a bit thin so noisy neighbours can be a problem. The staff, both front and housekeeping, were very friendly and accommodating. The only real difficulty with this hotel is the lack of a drop-off/pick-up zone. Because it is located right on busy Yonge St. there is no loading zone. If you attempt to stop to unload or load during rush hour, you could be inviting an expensive fine and a lot of annoyed drivers. The best bet is to stop on the side street, Melinda St., and walk a few feet. Go to their website to see if they have any special offers. They are currently promoting a $102 per night for 2 nights. The price reflects the age of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: PauloHDeSouza
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay in Toronto you can check in Hotel Victoria with no fear. Clean rooms, kind and great staff, excellent location and fair rates. Next time in Toronto I'll stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best anniversary ever!”
Reviews.Author: Laura N
Reviews.Content: Best hotel stay I've ever had! Every year my boyfriend and I celebrate our anniversary by having a hotel night, our normal hotel was unavaliable so we looked around and immediatly fell in love with the modern decor of these rooms. The location was amazing, having Netflicks avaliable to us as well was wonderful, and the hotel staff were very very nice! I think my boyfriend and I have found a new hotel for our future anniversaries! To sum up my experience: it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Hockey Stay”
Reviews.Author: dad-n-son
Reviews.Content: Can not beat the location for a night of hockey. It is a block north of the Hall of Fame and a very short walk to the ACC. The room was more than big enough for two adults. The hotel was easy to find and clearly marked, which was very helpful. Parking is not on-site but in the public garage on the same block. Not a big problem, but just be certain to unload before parking.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here January 21, 2012. Was perfect place to stay and be close to the heart of the city. Loved the history and the beautifully appointed room. We stayed in a queen suite and lovd the decor and layout. Very close to ACC,St. Lawrence Market and right on younge street. Very helpfull front desk staff. Beds were super comfy...wish I had one at home!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Small rooms. Perfect for 1 night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Skittle54
Reviews.Content: Unsure of where to stay in Toronto, I booked this place based on location/price/reviews. Pleasantly surprised. Great location. 2 minute walk to King subway station. 10 minute easy walk to Union Train station. Small rooms (i.e. bedroom size rather than a suite) but clean, comfortable. Free wifi. Good heating. Close by to a Shoppers Drug Mart; pub across the street; Subway next store. The hotel has a small restaurant but limited hours. There are lots of places nearby to eat so this wasn't a problem. They allowed me to check in early so I appreciated the customer service. Elevator seemed a bit slow but this would be my only criticism. Was perfect place that met all of my needs for a quick business trip into town. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem - Already Booked My Next Stay”
Reviews.Author: PEIsland-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Was in Toronto in the fall (Oct. 2011) for meetings and was looking for somewhere to stay for 9 nights. While looking for a reasonably priced room I stumbled upon The Victoria Hotel. It was the terrific rate that caught my attention. The posted reviews were mostly positive (and the negative ones, I've decided after my stay, can mostly be dismissed). I did heed the comments of the small size of the standard rooms and booked a one of the larger rooms which was quite roomy. I had a single room with a king bed, sitting area, work station, good size bath and FREE Wi-Fi, plus free Netflix (although worthwhile movie choices are limited - not a hotel issue). My room faced Yonge St. but the street noise was not an issue on any of the nights during my stay. I know it's only a 3 star hotel but my only complaint, while 2 actually, would be 1) no bag liner for the ice bucket (grocery store bags for fresh produce worked well) and 2) no glassware for drinks, only small, flimsy plastic cups (a trip to a dollar store rectified that problem). The basement area where the ice machine is can be described as claustrophobic but clean and also a small book exchange table with a couple of good reads. If I had a car, I would be put off by no on site parking, but no need for a car with the proximity of the hotel to downtown venues, entertainment, dining and shopping. It is also just steps away from the subway and The PATH (underground walkway). The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “perfect getaway spot for a night in the city”
Reviews.Author: rhartless
Reviews.Content: A great spot and beautiful little hotel. Loved the room, location, and service. I only rate the cleanliness slightly lower because of a long dark hair on our towels and some hairs on the bathroom floor. Pretty minor stuff, but they did still take away from our experience. Our bathroom light switch did not work properly either, which again was minor but slightly irritating. Don't let these things deter you though, it was a beautiful little hotel in a perfect spot. you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great walk-to location”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: Great location, price, pleasant staff,best overall value for a hotel right downtown and right next to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage Ambience with Modern Appointments”
Reviews.Author: Gary S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several days over the past three months. I have come to really like the hotel, its convenient downtown location and its well thought-out rooms. All the rooms have been revovated; equipped with wireless; and have beds as comfortable as the best hotels. Desk areas are compact but very appropriate. All staff are very accomodating and effective at their jobs. Client satisfaction is important to each employee. Only two areas that could use future improvements are the infiltration of downtown noise from traffic and the need to replace the elevator with a faster, smoother, higher tech model.

Reviews.Title: “The Leafs Won!”
Reviews.Author: Luigia60
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for one night as we were attending a hockey game at the Air Canada Centre. It is located within walking distance and is very close to restaurants, pubs, etc. The added bonus is if you are attending an event, you can show your ticket on check-in and you will receive a discount on your room. The hotel room was clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Mike013
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Hotel Victoria this past weekend for a hockey game at the Air Canada Center. The hotel was in a terrific location with only a short walk to the Hockey Hall of Fame and Air Canada Center. The room was small but completely updated with a good sized bathroom and the twin beds were very comfortable. Having a breakfast / lunch cafe inside the hotel was definitely convenient too. I would recommend to anyone traveling to Toronto and wanting to be close to "hockey central". We did take a 15 minute walk to Gretzky's restaurant, which was underwhelming and empty on a Friday night. I would not recommend. On the day of the game we ended up at a place called Casey's around the corner from the ACC for a bite before the game and drinks afterwards. They made room for the 14 of us and reserved tables after the game for us. Excellent food and drinks and tons of t.v.s for sports.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Experience”
Reviews.Author: VALuv2travel
Reviews.Content: Although its exterior is quite unprepossessing, the Victoria has a number of excellent attributes. It is well priced, and its location is ideal with many excellent restaurants and atttractions within close proximity. We found the service to be outstanding and the room was clean and comfortable. It is adjacent to a restaurant which we found to be an ideal breakfast spot. We were delighted with this hotel and would have no hesitation to return to the Victoria should we have occasion to visit Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: kimpete8
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, at 11:30 in the morning, the service was exceptional. While it was obviously too early to get our reserved room, they checked us in anyway, so we could just pick up our keys when we came back later. They also stored our bags for us and when we came back after lunch, they had put our bags in our room or us. Throughout our 2 days there, the staff was unfailingly helpful and courteous. The room was spacious and comfortable, and the beds were super comfortable, and at $114/night in the heart of downtown, the Hotel Victoria is a great deal too. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more”
Reviews.Author: fabio f
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the numerous reviews from various travel websites. Things we liked: 1. Location - right on Yonge Street. Bars, restaurants and the Distillery District are just a few minutes away. In addition, it's easy to get to tourist hotspots such as the CN Tower (walking distance), the Art Gallery and the Royal Ontario Museum (both by subway). 2. Our reservation included breakfast at the Over Easy resto adjacent to the hotel. The meal was fantastic. Not only was the amount of food plentiful, the service was great and I especially enjoyed the diner-like atmosphere. 3. The beds - the most comfortable beds we have ever slept on. Apparently, the hotel has just undergone a recent renovation. There were lots of fluffy pillows and the blankets were silky smooth. 4. The service - One reason we chose Hotel Victoria was because of its size. I could have stayed at the Royal York nearby for nearly the same price. The staff paid attention to our every need (which admittedly, was not much). Nevertheless, they made us feel at home. Check-in was super easy, and I especially liked that we were able to check in around 10:30am. The staff also recommended a few cool restaurants. 5. The decorations - the entire place, including the rooms, was superbly styled. Basic, clean, and smart design. Things we didn't like: Can't think of any.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dbfoley
Reviews.Content: We always stay here when in Toronto. The staff are very nice and the rooms clean and neat. Plus right across the street from an excellent Irish Pub

Reviews.Title: “Nice one night stay in historical gem”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMikeyJ
Reviews.Content: We got a decent deal online by having to show our concert ticket to Bon Iver at Massey Hall. The queen room was small but nice and recently updated, the hotel was in a great location about a ten minute walk to Queen street and only a few minutes from the GO station / Union. We paid a little extra for the "Business Room" which came with a bottle of water - although there was no fridge, a paper in the morning and Apple TV, which was a good to have after the show. The only faults: we were a disappointed when we asked downstairs for wine glasses on our way in, as we brought a bottle for after the show; and the pillows were a bit high/full for us - pretty minor. The breakfast down in the adjoining restaurant, Over Easy was great in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A Cozy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rowdygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Victoria on Monday, December 12, 2011 on a 'Bed and Breakfast' deal. The 100+ year old hotel nestled between Wellington and King Streets on Yonge St. in Toronto only has 56 rooms that have been updated and are urban chic. Our deal included breakfast vouchers for the adjoining restaurant - Over Easy - totalling $24 which covered the fixed menu breakfast (juice, eggs, toast and hash browns) or could be put towards any other breakfast menu items. The deluxe king room ( http://www.hotelvictoria-toronto.com/rooms-deluxe-king/ ) was clean, had a large wall-mounted TV and free Netflix. The bathroom was small but clean and functional. Although we were on the busiest street in the city, the street noise wasn't bothersome. This hotel is within easy walking distance to Union Station and right around the corner from the King subway station. I hope to find an excuse to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & clean with supportive staff”
Reviews.Author: Phil268
Reviews.Content: Convenient location downtown. The staff were courteous and helpful. The room was modern and suited our needs for a one night rental.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: HPMC
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to check this place out and I have to say, it was pretty good. We went for a weekend out in the Toronto and it's walking distance to everywhere. Modern decor and nice reception area. LOVED the shower head in the bathroom. We've been to a few hotels all over and this is probably one of the best showers we've had at a hotel. :P For parking on weekend, definitely park underground off of Wellington. After 6pm it's $5! If you are in the area, definitely don't neglect to walk (5min) to St. Lawrence Market on the weekend or take a 10min walk down to the waterfront. Rooms were smallish but well appointed and very clean. Comfortable beds. Please note, they do take a copy of your credit card but I think for a smaller establishment that is normal. Do not be taken aback by it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: vancouveritess
Reviews.Content: After reading the more recent reviews of this hotel (after renovations) on several websites and checking out all the pictures, we booked this hotel for a family visit in TO. Also, kudos to the hotel for replying to reviews on this site! As many other reviewers also noted, the location is great and very central, the service is excellent and the renovations modern and marvelous. We loved the high ceilings, modern and zen-like colour scheme and the floor in our StandardQueen room, it looked sleek and the added bonus was that no carpet meant less dust (great because my husband has asthma). The bed was perfect, firm and not too soft (great after a stressful day and no backaches in the morning). Despite it being on a busy street, noise was not really a problem in our room, which faced the street. The bathroom was a little less roomy. The only things that are good to know is that it is a smaller hotel without its own parkade (duh). There was no gym, it would be great if they would lend out yoga mats etc. to use in the room. The bathroom was kind of smaller. Also, it would have been great if slippers were available (I always end up bringing my own). We always try to book smaller boutique hotels when away for business or pleasure, since they usually have better service and are frankly, just nicer to stay at. Hotel Victoria certainly lived up to our expectations! We'll definitely stay here again for our anniversary this December!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint-cool...”
Reviews.Author: markmccauley
Reviews.Content: I can't remember what the Hotel Victoria was prior to it very obvious, recent refurb, but the present incarnation is quite deceent. At the time of this review, I expect the reno is still undeway. The lobby is very modern and very clean. At check in, I was somewhat surprised that the front desk person requested my credit card be pre-authorized for $125 for incidentals. Further, an old school carbon imprint was taken. Not concerning, but a little antiquated for 2011. I was graciously afforded a room upgrade from my Expedia Elite card. Queen Standard to Queen Business. Not sure how they differ, but expect it is based on a a dozen or so square feet and $20-$30 in rate. A quick turn around the corner and into the elevator is where I discovered that the reno was not entirely complete. Beat up and scracthed, it obviously fell lower on the list of priorities. As well, the hallways of the fourth floor looked unaddressed. When I entered my room, it was very late and I could not find the light switch, which in a hotel is typically located right at the entrance of the room. I felt my way through the dark and turned on a lamp. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was small, but all furnishing very new, very clean and a full compliment. Flat screen television, ipod dock/alarm clock*, iron, housecoat, hair dryer, the usuals. Missing is a minibar or cooler. Also, the alarm clock was poorly chosen. It had calculatror screen colour rather than LED, so cannot be viewed during the night. Also, the maid did not disengage the alarm from the night before, so I was alarmed an hour earlier than I had hoped. The windows to my room opened nicely to a centre atrium. There must have been a steel roof, because I heard the light pitter-patter of the rain throughout the night. The bathroom was small, but the shower had more pressure than any hotel I think I've ever been to. The location is second to none. 200 or so metres from the train station, the subway system is directly out front. Restaurants everywhere and some of the main touristsites of the city including The Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre and Sony Centre or Hummingbird (whatever they call it these days). It's also two blocks from financial district. While it is not a super-organized franchise hotel, it is quaint, cozy and quiet (with only fifty-some rooms). I think that is why I liked it so much. I got a great deal on the rate, but I think I would stay here regardless. Star rating seems to be three on a lot of sites. They definitely deserve 3.5 and maybe even four. As soon as the renos are complete, this will be a boutique-force-to-be-reckoned-with hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: FNFanatic
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I would ever find such a nice hotel for just over $100 in downtown Toronto. The location is incredible - Union Station, Air Canada Centre, CN tower, Steam Whistle brewery, St. Lawrence Market, shops and restaurants are all so close by! The rooms were small, but nicely decorated and had all we needed. The reception personnel were very helpful and accomodating, taking a picture of us by the lovely fireplace in the lobby and printing out a document for me on the day we left. We would definitely stay here again and may already be planning our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Romantic Weekend”
Reviews.Author: rachael e
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday. What a fantastic value! The king room was great. The location is awesome - you can walk or take the subway. But the best part of the stay was the awesome service and helpfulness of the staff. I asked for help with having champagne and cheese in our room when we arrived as well as having some pastries delivered. The front desk staff accomodated all of my requests and helped me to make my boyfriend's birthday one of his most memorable. If you plan on visiting Toronto you definitely want to stay at this fabulous little hotel with a big heart and excellent service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Awesome location, and FREE WIFI”
Reviews.Author: Potat0zilla
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of it's location and price. Location wise, you are in the heart of downtown. The HHOF(Hockey Hall of Fame), CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Dundas Square, St. Lawrence Market, Union Station, and many other places are in walking distance. Rooms: I booked a standard queen since I was traveling solo. I absolutely loved this room. No, it's not huge, but it is very roomy. The decor is modern, but it's a comfortable cozy modern. The colors are relaxing, and the hardwood floors are a nice touch. The bed was so comfortable I had a rough time getting up to go to a conference... I was sick the first few days of my trip, and was bed-ridden. I never once felt the urge to scurry out of the room. Bathroom: I don't require a lot of room in the bathroom, so a smaller bathroom is fine with me. The shower was nice! Staff: The staff was so helpful AND nice. I never once had a snotty person. Nothing is worse than feeling like your business isn't wanted, and that was not the case with this hotel. Amenities: Free WIFI is the best amenity ever, in my opinion. There is an on-site restaurant to the left of the lobby called Over Easy. I loved this restaurant! Overall, I was very impressed with this hotel. It's one of my favorite hotels, and I am planning to come back next October. I will be staying at Hotel Victoria again! Oh, and the price...you cannot beat it in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in newly-renovated boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: excentrus
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been around for years....but has recently undergone major renovations and it is now a small jewel in the central business district of Toronto. Strong points are the location next to subway, the excellent value and the attention to service...from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. Bravo. Superior king room was located facing the busy street and next to the elevator shaft. I anticipated noise from the elevator but was pleasantly suprised that I did not hear anything at all. Of course, street noise is unavoidable but was not a major problem, especially at night. The room was renovated and the design was very modern and appealing. I like high ceilings and wood floors....and both are present. No more old-style carpeting in the rooms YAY! The king size bed was super comfortable and the freshly-renovated bathroom was small but very efficient. Great shower. Free Internet connection and new flat-screen TV worked perfectly. I would have given this hotel a five points....but the telephone was old and the carpet in the hallways was a bit worse for wear. The front desk told me they are up-dating the telecommunication system in the near-future. So, this little hotel will be near perfect....and I would not hesitate to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Little Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jenn Jer L
Reviews.Content: This past stay at Hotel Victoria was our 6th stay. We always stay here when in town for a concert. The location is great, the staff in amazing, the atmosphere is modern but warm. You feel like a star staying. We 1st stayed at this hotel a few years ago b4 the renovations took place and we loved it then. Now with eveything all new and shiny we absolutely will NOT stay anywhere else and continue to recommened it to all of our friends and family. We will be heading to Toronto again in a few short months for another concert and have already booked our room. Can't wait to stay at Hotel Victoria once again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: snowcountry_11
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based mostly on TripAdvisor reviews! The hotel is in a great location! We walked to the Market area, CN Tower, and downtown shopping. We chose a Business Queen room after reading the reviews. The only complaint: the room was set for 1 person rather than 2. We had to ask for a second coffee each day. The hotel was clean, quiet, and in a great location. The reviews said there would not be a view from our room....but we were out most of the day so that was OK. The rooms are not huge, just as the reviews stated, but we stayed out most of the day so it was OK. We would definitely stay again if we were in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough for a one night stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: GoKingBee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night in Toronto "just because". We selected the Hotel Victoria because it was right on Yonge St and right town down near restaurants and the Eaton Centre. The hotel is a pretty old building with 12' ceilings in the rooms. We had a basic room which was pretty small - but certainly big enough for the time we were actually in the room. Bed was comfortable and other than a dusty cupboard shelf the room was clean. Bathroom was nice, but they have probably learned that wallpaper in a bathroom is not the best idea. Front desk staff were attentive and actually let us into our room at noon even though checkin wasn't til 3 o'clock. Overall - I'd stay there again for a "one nighter".

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourites..”
Reviews.Author: sleblancdicresce
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Hotel Victoria on a number of occasions. Our first stay was based on a recommendation by a family member and now we recommend it to friends and family as well. The rooms aren't huge, but for me, they also have a more "homey" feel which I take comfort in. We almost always expect to see Peter at the desk and we almost always do. He makes excellent recommendations and goes out of his way to make sure everything is just right. When there is a snag, it's dealt with quickly and fairly. The hotel is easy to get to when travelling into T.O. and it's close to so many things. The only time we were disappointed was when we couldn't get a room because the whole place had been booked up by conventioneers. The place we stayed instead didn't begin to match up but cost a whole lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: LadyBird1975
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria has been nicely renovated and offers well appointed rooms that are simple and small but comfortable. The square footage of the rooms is small (i.e. New York small, not Paris small) but is all you really need. I would recommend this boutique hotel as a reasonably priced alternate to the other downtown hotels. You can find street parking at reasonable rates if you are willing to walk a few blocks -- no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: besuth
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Victoria for 5 nights in Sept.& were pleasantly surprised with the recent renovations .It is a 100 year old hotel so must be difficult to renovate. We were relying on public transport & with Central Station about 5 mins away-- much of it indoors -- it was a great location. Shuttle from Int airport took us to another hotel where we transfered to minibus to Victoria. Also many restaurants, markets etc Subway food next door.It was a very convenient spot.Walk to harbour. Free internet in lobby was useful & accessible. We were able to walk to Royal York Hotel for shuttle to Toronto Downtown airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: yenta47
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Victoria in Toronto for three nights in early November, 2011. Very disappointing...we arrived around 7 pm amid traffic. There was no designated unloading space for our car. There is no valet service and we had to unload our car by ourselves. The staff person on duty was of no help and was very dismissive of our need for assistance. We got to our room and found it was located next to the elevator so we aked for a different room based on our reservation request. We did get a new room, but were told we might have to move later.Fortunately we did not have to move. Although the room was pleasant, the bathroom was in need of serious repairs. The wallpaper was coming off all over. Our room swipe cards never worked and we had to go to the desk almost every time we came in. The day staff was more helpful.Overall, we were very displeased with Hotel Victoria and would not recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sondroyo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is a boutique hotel in downtown Toronto. It is very close to public transit - streetcar, PATH, and subway just around the corner - and separated enough from the party scene to allow for quiet. Rooms are smaller but newly decorated in a contemporary style. Only downside was that many rooms are alley-side, including mine. Believe I was given a business queen room which had a free bottle of water (!) and Apple TV with Netflix. Also free Wifi in all spaces. Go for a deluxe room, streetside, and you are all set at Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile for a night”
Reviews.Author: travelingarab
Reviews.Content: Wifi very poor and rooms small but clean and location good. Pity the attached restaurant cannot put the breakfast / meals bill on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, before I even Got there”
Reviews.Author: Simon M
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are staying here late November on an extended business trip. (for the first time) Before we have even stayed there, I can say I am more than satisfied with the service at this Hotel. I sent an email to the Sales Manager with a couple of questions about the hotel and he got back to me with polite answers\suggestions in a timely manner. This is officially the first time I have ever written a review before I have stayed somewhere. Looking forward to our experience there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value for money hotels I have stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: SeasideJol
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for a week early November 2011, have to say what a choice! I am normally fairly picky on hotels and do a lot of tripadvisor reading so when I came across this hotel, I was very happy. I dont need to load photos as the room I stayed in (Business Class) was just as the photos on the website show. That in itself was a shock to me!!! The staff are incredibly helpful and being right in the centre of downtown is good. Theres enough places in 10 minute walk to eat whatever you want and if you want the subway thats 2 minute walk to Kings. I didnt eat in the restaurant and infact only noticed it was there half way though my time there, maybe a little more advertising is needed to get people into the restaurant. The Wifi was decent speed, allowed direct connection to my VPN, which is sometimes an issue and had decent download speed. However, one downside is, dont expect a view! The hotel backs onto nothing and infact my room had a view of a wall. Didnt bother me at all, as I dont spend my time looking out of the window! For $120 a night in downtown, this would be definitely where I will come back, if I do to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emjog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Victoria for 5 days last week with my mother, at the end of my month-long stay in Canada. The hotel is lovely, we were greeted by friendly staff who were always very helpful whenever we had an enquiry. The room was clean and bright, I really liked the black and white contemporary dÃ©cor. It was a very small room, but being in the city centre I didn't expect much bigger. It was a disappointment not to have a bathtub, but then again in a city centre hotel it's not always possible. The location is fantastic, just a 10 minute walk to the CN Tower, 10 minutes to the harbour front, 5 minutes to Dundas Square & the Eaton Centre, and we used the hop-on, hop-off sightseeing bus most of the time, they have stops really close to the hotel and will even pick up from the hotel on your first day. My only negative comment is storage, although there's plenty of space for clothes, there's definitely a lack of hooks for coats and towels, and nowhere to put anything in the bathroom apart from on top of the toilet tank and around the sides of the sink. All in all I would definitely recommend, and will stay here again should I ever be back in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel Victoria”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethProsser
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this wonderful downtown hotel for over 5 years now. It is perfectly located on Yonge, just south of King and is central to everything! The rooms are lovely, well appointed and the beds are heavenly. It has recently undergone a wonderful renovation and has a unique boutique feel to it while continuing to honour the historic character of the building. The staff are always wonderful, especially Peter, who greets me by name and makes sure I have everything I need. I often take in shows while I'm inToronto and if you show your tickets, the Hotel kindly gives you a discount. It is well appointed and well-priced! There's also the terrific restaurant "Over Easy" located adjacent to the hotel where I enjoy a wonderful breakfast every morning!

Reviews.Title: “The Historic Hotel Victoria of Yonge Street”
Reviews.Author: AlDawson
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my fourth visit to the Hotel Victoria and was very pleased with the recent renovations. I spent sixteen nights in a Business Queen, which I found to be quiet, clean and just the right amount of space for my conference activities. The free WiFi kept me in touch with family and friends back home. The closeness to the King subway station was a definite plus. The Over Easy in the hotel, plus a multitude of other great restaurants in the immediate area (with two Tim Horton establishments less than a thrown Maple Dip away!) was a plus. On the nights when I felt like an informal meal, items from the nearby St. Lawrence Market (or the other - think foot-long! - Subway, steps away from the Victoria, satisfied my needs. It is definitely the best place to stay in Toronto! Al Dawson (Iowa City, Iowa)

Reviews.Title: “Central location bonus for a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Steve36
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Victoria, it is a very comfortable hotel in a fantastic central location. The good-sized room contained a lovely bed and a good sized bathroom. We booked a room including breakfast, which is provided in the attached diner, with vouchers - anything extra we wanted above the value of the vouchers we just paid cash for. It's a short walk from the hotel to many attractions and the main shopping areas. A very pleasant place to stay which we would have no hesitation staying in if we visit again, which we would laove to do as Toronto was a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Handy”
Reviews.Author: Alan U
Reviews.Content: Nice room if a bit small, but if you just want a place to sleep who cares, handy to the main centers (and Rodgers center). Good net wifi connection. loved it

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Furball01
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, just on Yonge and Wellington (close to Eaton centre for shopping and CN Tower Skydome for sightseeing). Althouigh, the breakfast was an extra cost (there is an over easy in the hotel), this was quite good value for money and a good way to start the day. The free wi-fi in the rooms was a God send. Room was nice and the shower was really good. I would definitely recommend people to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get in, get in!”
Reviews.Author: WLower
Reviews.Content: I know Toronto. Lived there. Worked there. When I don't live there (like now) this is my hotel of choice. I have stayed at this hotel over the years. Even before the renovations, it was a great bargain in a fantastic location. With the recent renovations, it is truly great. Rooms are a little on the small side but they are fine. I am a pacer so believe me, space matters. And the rooms are quiet. Bathrooms are great. And staff is always very helpful. Dollar for comfort, this is the best downtown Toronto has to offer. Returning there next month. Looking forward to it. One less travel thing to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “I would have paid more!”
Reviews.Author: lovemytanner
Reviews.Content: We booked plane tickets to Toronto before we realized that the TIFF was being held the same week. I was looking for a decent hotel deal but everything was way overpriced. I happened upon the hotel Victoria, luckily. Beautiful king deluxe room for about $100 less than an average hotel in the area. Super clean and comfortable. Great location too. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel at great price”
Reviews.Author: CRS111
Reviews.Content: I rarely give 5-star reviews for hotels but Hotel Victoria was absolutely fantastic and everything about it was excellent. My girlfriend and I booked here for three nights at the start of a two week visit to eastern Canada and were a bit wary as the price seemed too good for such a nice hotel in such a central location. However we were not disappointed. The room - fairly small but extremely comfortable beds and decorated as nicely as in the photos on the hotel website. The room came with big television screen, free Wifi and an iPhone/iPod docking station. The room and bathroom were both clean and the shower was also brilliant. My only minor complaint was that there was a lack of storage space in the rooms as the cupboards, drawers etc seemed to have things in them already e.g. folders, ironing board etc, but this is a very very minor complaint!! The location - excellent for anyone visiting the city as it is only 5-10mins from Dundas Square and the Eaton Centre, and even less to Union Station. The CN Tower/Rogers Centre and Air Canada Centre are all within easy walking distance, as is the waterfront. Staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful, there were various complimentary newspapers available to take away in the lobby each morning, and I'd also highly recommend 'Over Easy', the breakfast/lunch diner which is attached to the hotel and serves excellent food to start the day. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting Toronto and would like to be in a downtown location

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable room, air conditioning, attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: thomson25
Reviews.Content: Great for all the attractions, Harbour Front, Eaton Centre, transport links, street cars are amust do in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Karensyd
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I stayed at your beautiful hotel this past week. When we opened the door to our room, I was so happy to see her excitement. The room was just as she envisioned it. Black & white and beautifully done. This was our summer 3 day trip and we loved it. The staff was very helpful at pointing out restaurants and directions for us. When we come back we will be staying here again. Thank you for making our vist really complete. Nothing like coming back 'home' (as she called it) after a long day and relaxing in a beautiful clean room. :) Karen & Syd

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Toronot”
Reviews.Author: Tush
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, very comfortable and friendly. Convenient to everything and reasonable cost. Highly recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Beautifully Priced - Room only”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte0608
Reviews.Content: My boy friend and I stayed here for a night for some city sight seeing having returned from a fabulous cottage stay in Hailburton prior to flying home. Having stayed in quiet a few hotels I admit we where a little apprehensive bearing in mind its prime location and the low price for Toronto hotels. However, this was all in vain, the hotel was clean and our room, though compact was well thought out and of a high standard, in fact the bed was like sleeping on a cloud! Friends we were staying with also decided to stay at the hotel with us and having regularly stayed in Toronto they stated that their room at Hotel Victoria was better than the usual hotel they stayed at - The Royal York! Only downside to the hotel was a lack of parking - there is local parking nearby and staff helpfully gave a street map.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deb-terr
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our family have been staying at this lovely hotel in Toronto for over 20 years for either pleasure or business purposes. The location is excellent (very close to Via Rail, CN tower,the skydome, the Eaton Centre, all of the plays) staff very friendly and accommodating, rooms kept exceptionally clean and most recently beautifully renovated (even if they are a bit on the smaller size due to the age of the building!) , beds most comfortable, and Wi Fi accessible. It is also correct that if you needed materials printed out you would need to see the front desk to have this done for you. Parking only cost us $16.00 overnight on Sat. and we used the closest one to the hotel. I have also on occasion stayed at most of the other bigger and more expensive hotels downtown Toronto e.g. Royal York, Delta Chelsea, Sheradon, Holiday Inn, etc.; in comparison, Hotel Victoria may be smaller in size relatively speaking with fewer of the in-house perks such as swimming or restaurants, but it delivers much more quality, dollar for dollar, where it really counts!

Reviews.Title: “When don't I stay here...”
Reviews.Author: Jenn Jer L
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stay here EVERY time we come to Toronto (at least twice a year, live 9hrs north, now!!). It looks super uber expensive but I think it is very affordable...especially for its location and the quality of the hotel. You can't get any better. The staff are amazing, very helpful and have great personalitlies!!! The basic rooms are very comfortable, very quiet, and are worth every penny. VERY CLEAN!!! Not once have we had an issue OR do we have any complaints. We would never stay anywhere else. Hotel Victoria is the only place to stay in Toronto in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice & GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: b3inRaleigh
Reviews.Content: We got lucky with a great rate on Hotels.Com for a two night stay in a Deluxe room at Hotel Victoria. The hotel is very centrally located on Yonge St (the main drag in Toronto) and within minutes to most anything you'd want - Harbor Front, Union Station, Hockey Hall of Fame, Rogers Stadium, CN Tower, St.Lawrence Market, etc. Our room was a Deluxe King & was very nice & comfortable. It appeared to have been recenty redone & the decor was beautiful. We had a mini-fridge, coffee maker, Ipod docking station, flat screen TV, and a beautiful bathroom. Our room faced Yonge Street, and there was a bit of street noise, but we were so tired by the time we came back to the room each night that it didn't matter (certainly didn't keep us up a night). We found the hotel staff to be very helpful and imformative. Just a tip: As others have mentioned, you will have to pay to park at a garage down the street, as there is no parking for the hotel on site. There is also nowhere to pull up to unload your luggage in front of the Hotel (Yonge Street is super busy!), so you'll need to park in a garage & wheel your stuff in. We parked behind the Novotel Hotel & the rate was $14/day, which was super reasonable in comparison to other parking garage rates we saw. Also, the Hotel has free wireless & a computer in the lobby, but there is nowhere to print in the lobby (you have to ask a staff member to assist you with printing if you need to print something, which is not a big deal, but there is not a standard "business center"). Overall, we'd definitely stay at Hotel Victoria again & would recommend it to others travelling to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Toronto on a budget”
Reviews.Author: 4allisons
Reviews.Content: If you're on an expense account, or Other People's Money, those $350 rooms across the street are plenty fine. Nothing wrong with 'em at all. But if you're spending your own money, you can easily save a thousand dollars or so by staying in this perfectly nice hotel. Smack in the middle of downtown, it's just a few blocks from the business district, St. Lawrence Market, the CN tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, whatever. So the location is just about perfect. The rooms seem to be recently-renovated, perfectly clean, nice bathroom and shower, flat screen TV, comfortable beds, and a nice little desk where you can set up your computer and hook up to the free WiFi. Other reviewers have said the rooms are small, and sure. There's no living room--you won't be entertaining guests in here. No separate couch or anything like that, and there isn't a bunch of space for kids to run around. But the rooms aren't cramped, the bathroom's got plenty of space, you're not bumping into things, and there's certainly enough room to work at the desk. I've stayed in some postage stamp rooms in New York City and that's not what this is. It's a small, clean room, with a good sized bathroom and plenty of workspace. And the price is right. There's no parking in the building. But if you're coming in by car you're gonna save another $30 per night by following the clerk's advice and parking two blocks over at the Municipal Garage. Parking at the big hotels around here, and at the other garages, runs about $40 to $50 per 24 hours! (Check the signs--they all have a "maximum daily rate" that only lasts from 6am to 6pm. You also have to pay for the other 12 hours, from 6pm to 6am.) The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful, the facility was charming, the location can't be beat, the rooms were perfect for what we needed (for us, at least, we can handle a few days without a spa and a weight room :-). Honestly, when I read some of the other reviews, I was a little worried about staying here. But when we showed up, it turned out to be a wonderful and delightful place. And the money we saved, compared to the big hotels, is huge. We ended up saving about a thousand dollars and for us at least, that's a pretty big deal. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel downtown”
Reviews.Author: Prairies2011
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three nights at this terrific hotel. Close to everything, clean and beautifully appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: leahlavergne
Reviews.Content: Everything from the knowledgeable staff, the modern decor, cleanliness and restaurant built in was perfect. I was beyond pleased with the service and what a perfect location! Walk from Union station, Eaton centre, Great Eats and the Distillery District. You won't find a better price! I'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Grauntie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Victoria five times in the past seven years, and continue to enjoy this small boutique hotel. We first chose the hotel because of location -- It is a 10 minute walk from Union Station, a 3 min. stroll to the King St. Metro stop, and 10-15 min. walk to the entertainment district. We return because the rooms are always extremely clean, the amenities better than average, and the staff at reception are kind and accommodating without being effusive. There are very good restaurants in the area, and the St. Lawrence Market is close enough to gather together a picnic meal. Yes, the rooms are smaller than a large chain hotel, but perfectly adequate, and we don't go to Toronto to spend time lounging in our room. The recent renovations now make the Victoria a higher end boutique hotel in our opinion, and our only concern is that we might not continue to enjoy the very moderate price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Shannonvillegreen
Reviews.Content: This little hotel (56 rooms) is a hidden gem in downtown Toronto. Located right on Yonge Street bewteen Adelaide and Fronts Streets, it has very few faults. Parking isn't available on site, but a 7 minute walk away, which isn't a problem because you can unload and then drive to the parking garage and walk back. All quite safe and reasonalbe (our parking was $21). The room we had was a Business Queen - beautifully appointed, small, big TV, free Netflicks, free wireless Internet, great bathroom - and amazingly quiet! Our room was on the 4th floor and looked into a courtyard, so there wasn''t any traffic noise. The staff at the front desk was very helpful and thorough. There is a small restaurant (Over Easy) adjacent to the lobby that serves breakfast and lunch - very good and reasonably priced. I would definitely go back and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here - won't be the last!”
Reviews.Author: Sedonamoon
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to spend a night or two if you are staying in the city and don't need to spend a lot of time in your hotel. The hotel is historic - that means the rooms are smaller than the big chain hotels around. The rooms are clean and recently updated. We stayed here before the upgrades & were impressed with its cleanliness then. The beds are comfy, the staff is pleasant, the price is right, & there is a great place for breakfast/lunch off the lobby - "The Good Egg". The pancakes are shaped like a maple leaf! This is our go-to place for a weekend getaway in Toronto. We parked our car @ a garage a few blocks down & walked where we needed to go - feeling comfortable & safe the whole time. If all you need is a clean bed & bath while in town (and a tasty breakfast!) - this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Unethical establishment and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: berrigrl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here originally for one evening after we booked on a website. Although the hotel was very small and in the middle of construction and had no restaurant, room service or amenities, it was centrally located and we elected to stay another night at full rate. Upon checking out the following day, we were informed that we incurred a charge for smoking in our room of $135.00. We absolutely DID NOT smoke in our room. The only evidence for this accusation that we know of was an empty pack of cigarettes left by my friend in the trash can when cleaning out her bag. We were told the room reeked of cigarettes, although I am allergic to cigarette smell. The staff treated us like common criminals and were rude beyond belief. This charge apparently was in reference to our first night, yet we were not informed of this impending accusation and charge when booking another night of course. The general manager was not available and we were told the charges WOULD NOT be reversed by the rooms manager. They offered no proof other than the fact that cleaning staff claimed it smelled, but admitted work crews had been in and out of the room. As a result of this experience I highly discourage staying at this hotel. The Hotel Edward is a far superior hotel very close on the next block on York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: threepiggs
Reviews.Content: Stay for 6 nights in Deluxe Queen Twin room which was very nice. Front desk staff helpful and Carla very nice and extra helpful with advice and directions. Hotel is only a block from the Hockey Hall of Fame. There are several places to eat in easy walking distance. Rating would be 5 stars except bathroom is small and there is no chair with arms in the room. We will stay here any time we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “You MUST stay here!”
Reviews.Author: MandaB91
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Victoria in the beginning of this month and simply had to write a review immediately. This hotel exceeded my expectations. We are from Philadelphia/New Jersey (There were 6 of us) and going to see the sights and best of all, see the Phillies play the Blue Jays. We didn't have to take ANY transportation at all for the whole 4 days we were there, which is HUGE, because we did A LOT. We were in walking distance to the CN Tower, Blue Jays Stadium, Hockey Hall of Fame, a huuuge mall, and Second City Comedy Theater, and a ton of nightlife and restaurants. The fact that we didn't have to take transportation is a fabulous thing in itself, because that could add up if needing to take taxi's, etc. I stayed in a room with four people (2 double beds) The rooms were very spacious, very clean, and we even had a great view of the city where we could literally look out of our window and point and say "Let's go THERE tonight!" Admittedly, when we first arrived, there was an issue with our 2 friends who were staying in a seperate room. They didn't have anything saying that they were staying there and all the rooms were full at that point. They did, however, accomodate them by allowing them to stay in my room, which was kind because they're not supposed to do that. As we were getting ready for dinner, they called saying they figured it out and they could go to their own room. Although it was a predicament at first, they handled it professionally and solved the issue right away. There is also a restaurant downstairs where we had breakfast and it was super yummy. The staff was very friendly, the location was AMAZING, the hotel is gorgeous. I have been many places but this was definitley my favorite vacation ever.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Lizziek91
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were looking for a cheap, decent hotel in downtown Toronto that would be close to all of the major attractions and public transportation. For the price (compared to other hotels downtown), I was expecting this hotel to be strictly budget. It far exceeded my expectations. It's recently remodeled and it shows. For $144, we got a deluxe queen room with a mini fridge. The room was extremely clean and very chic. The view wasn't the greatest (the windows were dirty) but there wasn't much to see except the stores across the street. It was very quiet and a great place to crash after hectic days of sightseeing (we stayed for three nights). You won't get an incredible view like some of the hotels downtown, parking is a pain (I suggest relying on public transportation if you stay here), and there is no pool or exercise room. It was, however, an extremely good deal for the price, clean, cute, and up-to-date. The location cannot be beat (you can walk to the lake, the CN tower is a quick streetcar ride away, and the King subway station is a short walk up the street). I honestly cannot imagine staying anywhere else if I ever visited Toronto again

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: monks17
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jun13-15 in the Queen deluxe on the 7th flr. The room was exactly the same as in the picture. The beds were comfy and rooms were very clean. Recommend keeping the fan on to cover street noise. The window blinds do not cover the windows and makes for a very bright 7am. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant on site was more expensive than Sunset Grill which was only a few blocks north. This hotel is in central downtown within walking distance of shopping, the Rogers Centre and the harbour. We would definitely recommend this hotel to couples who need a comfortable room to sleep after enjoying the sites of beautiful downtown Toronto. We look forward to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Needs substantial improvement”
Reviews.Author: See_me_in_TN
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe double. The room was small, and lighting was limited. The wireless internet signal was very weak, and I was involuntarily disconnected several times. The bathroom lacked space to place anything larger than a cup or two. Street noise was louder than expected. Room was clean, but bed was only average.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Brooklyn29
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been updated and looks really great. If you are looking for ammenities, this is not the place for you (no pool, gym, etc.), if you are looking for a clean and very convenient hotel with helpful staff, this is the place!! Also, the bed was new and extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and great service for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Magenta11059
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful (concierge printed travel documents and theatre tickets for us and housekeeping staff were very pleasant and helpful). We stayed in a standard room, no fridge, however it was fantastic as we were at the back of the building, while we didn't have a view there was absolutely no noise and we got an excellent nights sleep for the duration of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem and would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: olga065
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel on April 5th for only one night. The hotel has just been remodelled. The price was just right and the accommodations were beyond our expectations. Definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate.”
Reviews.Author: LibbyD
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel if you're looking for basic acccomodation with few luxuries. After all the complaints of small romms we were happily surprised to have a really huge room. This is the double bedded room at the front of the hotel. Street noise is present but wasn't much of a problem, possibly because it was a very cold night. I'm always disappointed to find plastic and paper cups, and there were too few electric outlets for computer, chargers etc. There is no parking and unloading the car at the curb with Toronto traffic rushing by is no joy. The Irish Embassy across the street stood in for the lack of a hotel bar, and we finished the evenings quite happily there. Altogether the hotel was comfortable; as always, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “If you're on a budget here's the place....”
Reviews.Author: zyder9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in the summer and wasn't really surprised at what we had booked. I checked reviews on here first and given the fairly positive feedback and the low price I was happy enough. If I had paid a lot more or expected a glamorous hotel I would have flipped. Our window view consisted of air conditioning units and the room was tiny. Elevator seemed dodgy too. One the whole though, staff were helpful, the place was clean and the richtree a few doors down was perfect for breakfast (don't bother with the hotels own breakfast). As it's been said before, this hotel is great for location, we walked everywhere we wanted to go like the CN tower, train station, Baseball stadium and the waterfront bars.

Reviews.Title: “Our third time at Hotel Victoria and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Casina_di_Rosa
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Hotel Victoria since 2006. We really like the location of the hotel, so central that makes a car rental totally unnecessary, close to the train station and well served by public transportation. The rooms with queen beds are not very spacious, but they are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Excellent Room!”
Reviews.Author: garyb13
Reviews.Content: REALLY thrilled with the newly renovated room. My 2nd stay in 2 years at this hotel was a â€˜hitâ€™, as the renovated room had hardwood floors, flatscreen TV, updated bathroom and super comfortable mattress with a light duvet! Room at back of hotel was quiet, and spacious and an excellent value. I was not as happy with the room I had last year as it was on busy Yonge street, so if a lite sleeper like me, ask for rooms at the back of the property.Though I did not eat this year at the hotel breakfast restaurant, I know from my stay in 2009 that it serves good quality food at reasonable prices. I also got a takeout supper at the MÃ¶venpick MarchÃ© Restaurant on 42 Yonge [half a block from hotel], which is a great place to get quality food prepped for takeout orders at various stations like seafood, pasta, etc. I plan on returning there in future when in town for pleasure, and not just for a conference, but it was a 15 minute walk to the Metro Convention Centre and much cheaper than most hotels in the city! It was only a 10 minute walk to the train station. Staff were courteous and helpful..and patient!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing amazing, but did the job”
Reviews.Author: roaming-wifi
Reviews.Content: This was pretty basic accommodation at a rate of $146USD a night. I found the location to be pretty good and we walked to most places. The hotel is undergoing some renovations as it does need some updating. It was very simple accommodation, a little cramped but it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mel6636
Reviews.Content: Located right in the middle of everything you'd want, this quaint old hotel is anything but the feeling of old. The walls are thick, the people are very helpful, the food from "OverEasy" (attached restaurant) is so delicious and fresh.... we have zero regrets and are very pleased with our one night stay here. In one day we covered most of Toronto's tourist and non-tourist attractions by foot including St Lawrence Market, Eaton Center, CN Tower, Union Station, St James Cathedral, Steam Whistle Brewery, and Chinatown. The rates were extremely reasonable. It's easy to get by bus/subway (only $3/person for the full way) by bus/subway from the airport. The only downfall is if you had a rental car; there is no parking. We knew this in advance, however, so didn't pick up a rental car until day 2 and it was within walking distance. While on vacation I had to work (online) and internet access was very easy to access and utilize. We had zero issues all around. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not anything special, very small room”
Reviews.Author: mel07
Reviews.Content: Location is good but room was very small and dark. Expected to have character as stated on reviews read but had none at all. Stated all rooms have bath ours didn't and shower smelt of damp. Staff were very helpful, friendly and looked after our bags as had late flight, other than that thought was expensive for what you got.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: Pippadidoodah
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Hotel during the Toronto International Film Festival. Great location at the Downtown end of Yonge St. Didn't see any celebs, but the atmosphere was great. The Hotel is small but the staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but comfortable and clean - exactly what you need in a downtown location as you will probably not be in the room for long. There is no restaurant at the Hotel, but there is a restaurant next door that provides great breakfasts and lunch. Very pricey though. We found The Sunset Grill about 2 blocks North was much better value for money for breakfast. They cater for healthy and not so healthy preferences.

Reviews.Title: “Nice smaller hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tdogr
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the economical price and location for a 1 night stay with my wife. I was happy with the location as we walked less than 20 minutes to almost everywhere we wanted to see: ferry to Toronto Islands (loved it), CN Tower, Yonge downtown, and Distillery District. The lobby was very clean, the staff were helpful, and there is a nice restaurant for breakfast inside. There is one computer to use and being a small hotel (8 floors, about 6 rooms per floor) we never had trouble getting on it. The room was very small but nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but characterless with small dark room”
Reviews.Author: danthewhaler
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for the last two nights of our trip on the basis that it was in a good central location and had some degree of character as gleaned from the internet. Location was good and it was clean and well run, but it was as anonymous as any major chain of hotels ordinary box-type room would be. The lobby was small and there was no public area to the hotel, just a desk a couple of sofas and then the lift to the rooms. Literally you were buying a room to sleep in and nothing else. The room itself was the smallest we had stayed in on the trip, ok but noticeably small and very, very dark. The second day was glorious sunshine outside but our room remained in near-twilight even with the curtains wide open. The two inadequate table lights in the room did little to make the situation better. Overall fine as a place to sleep (no noise at all) but nothing beyond that.

Reviews.Title: “Good experiance”
Reviews.Author: amandah62
Reviews.Content: Personally, I liked this hotel. It has a great location. It's minutes away from the Hockey Hall of Fame, just seconds away from King Subway station. (which was so convenient considering we went to the zoo by subway). It's a little walk to get to dundas and yonge, but not bad, maybe 15mins or so? The lobby was beautiful. The restaurant thats inside the hotel 'Over Easy' was really good! I can't comment on the price of the hotel, as I won a contest through their webside. Overall, the room was okay, good condition, everything worked. I've been in nicer rooms, but we're only their to sleep and relax anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay while in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: nanzab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, staff are all friendly, and the hotel is withing five minutes walking distance to Union Station, ACC, Hockey hall of fame, steps to the subway. An excellent place to stay if you are checking out some Toronto attractions. Some of the rooms are very small, but if you are touring you aren't really spending your day in the hotel, are you? The breakfast/lunch bar was nice and has a very large menu for its purpose. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller56
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Victoria and were disappointed with the experience. We chose this hotel because it had generally good reviews on TripAdvisor (though there were also a few negative ones). Also, Lonely Planet rated the Hotel Victoria as "one of Toronto's best small downtown hotels". We booked a standard room, and spent the first night in a very small room at the back of the hotel. This room was in very poor condition (eg furniture falling apart, bathroom door didn't close properly, towel hook behind the bathroom door falling off, wallpaper peeling off). We complained the next morning (only the second time we've ever complained about a hotel room in many years of travel) and were moved to a deluxe room at no extra charge for the next 3 nights. This room was larger and in somewhat better condition, but still had some peeling wallpaper and some of the power outlets failed during our stay. It was a much better room than our initial room, but was quite noisy as it faced onto Yonge Street. The reception staff were helpful and understanding, and we were treated well. Overall our stay was satisfactory, but the Hotel Victoria fell well short of our expectations, and was by far the worst accommodation we had on our Canadian trip (which was all in the same price range).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and service!”
Reviews.Author: KSBelle
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to St. Lawrence Market, Hockey Hall of Fame, The Harbour Area... the location could not be better! Having arrived in the recent horrible heat wave, walking around the city in mid-day was a challenge, but arriving back at the hotel was a delight - the air conditioning in our room got a work out and it did work well. Our double room had no excess space - besides the beds, the room held an entertainment/storage armoire, desk and night stand. The full size closet included a luggage rack. The bath was completely granite tile and came with all amenities, including hair dryer and exhaust fan. No room safe. Good in-room complimentary Wi-Fi. Great water pressure. Comfortable, supportive beds with extra pillows. The three restaurants that we tried for dinner - an Irish Pub, Wine Bar, and a Beer Bistro, were all within five minutes by foot.
