The staff of the hotel was quite helpful in giving directions and suggestions. In reading earlier messages, I had read that the the hotel was noisy... we did not find this to be the case. Our room was quiet. They are renovating the lobby, but we heard no noise. I will definitely return to the Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Got what we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: mikeroak
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night. The room was similar to many we have stayed at in New York such as the Benjamin. It had old school charm and was good for the price. Restaurant for breakfast in the lobby was a plus. Brian at the front desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “expensive hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: adridalba
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Victoria Hotel one night and we were very disappointed. The price is excessive, the room was really small and it had a view.. to a wall!!! It doesn't have a bar, the common room/hall/reception area is small too. The personnel was nice but I think we spent too much money in a small room with NO view at all. Next day we moved to the Westin Harbor, we paid less and we had a big room with an excellent view of the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your Hard Hat and hammer !”
Reviews.Author: LazyEyes
Reviews.Content: You Enter the lobby and you got strong paint smell, electric wires hangging out the celling and a fake fire place that is not plugged in lobby. Parking is a taxi distance away Rooms is clean but very very small enough for one bed and no way two people can fit in it. The view is of a wall. notice some fire alarams but no fire sprinklers There is free internet . If it was not for location it would be not worth more than $40 night and should be a 2 star hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate as an inexpensive stay”
Reviews.Author: rosasmum
Reviews.Content: The Victoria has two main attractions - its location and its price. I stayed in a deluxe king room on a recent weekend for $129 CAD the night. The room was certainly clean, if a bit small and boasted the usual amenities. While lower Yonge Street can be fairly noisy during the day, it's quiet here at night and I slept on a very comfortable bed undisturbed. The lobby is undergoing renovations, but there is no real problem with that.. I do feel that the money would be better spent on refurbishing the guest rooms. Mine had a slightly stained carpet and the paper was beginning to lift in parts of the scrupulously clean and spacious bathroom. A minor problem with the room was corrected promptly and cheerfully. On the whole, this is a pleasant small hotel, very conveniently located near Union Station and the financial and entertainment districts.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near to everything”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: stayed here for three nights. they are renovations going on at the moment in the lobby but don't let that put you off - we were on 2nd floor - newly renovated and didn't hear a thing. rooms are contemporary (new new blue woodedn floor) - clean rooms but be careful as bath in slippery - they have a bath mat for you to use. would have been nice if there were a few leaflets on site seeing in toronto - there was only a niagara leaflet. Must eat in Over Easy - restaurant just walk through hotel lobby - they do breakfast/lunch from 10am-4pm. the french toast and side of fresh fruit is magic. would recommend this hotel - hockey hall of fame is 5 minute walk - CN tower 15 mins and downtown shopping in yonge is a ten minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: JutebugAlberta
Reviews.Content: This historical hotel is in a great location on Yonge Street, within easy walking distance to lots of restaurants, bars, shopping and major attractions. We stayed 4 nights. Our room was small and our view was a brick wall, but it was very quiet, modern and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful, especially Peter who gave us many fine tips on where to go as we had never been to Toronto before. Behind the lobby is a fantastic restaurant, Over Easy, which was great for breakfast and lunch. The cooks are soup geniuses! Would definitely stay here again, hopefully when the lobby renovations are complete.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot near downtown with no frills”
Reviews.Author: Aliccia
Reviews.Content: A nice spot near downtown and historic places, were you can walk or use easily the subway (in case of heavy snow). The staff is not very friendly (Peter is rude, but Brian is nice) if you need some advices about what to do nearby. The room we thad was very small, with no fridge bar and a small but reasonable bed. The shower is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “comfy bed, great location - practicle not plush”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: The bed was super comfy. It was quiet and restful. The room itself of a bit dark (small room, dark colours) though there were two sets of windows that opened. Old school heating unit that blew hot air made things a bit too try. I needed to turn the heating off and on, as it was either too hot or too cold. That could just have been me - very jet lagged and intolerant. There is free internet - and it is good and strong, a definite plus as many hotels in Toronto charge for internet. Front desk people very nice and helpful. Location great for core of Toronto. At one point in time, it was a slightly chichi boutique hotel. It is a bit warn and tired but still perfectly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price, great staff, what else do you want to be happy, eh?”
Reviews.Author: Furryfeet
Reviews.Content: Great location, great price, great staff, what else do you want to be happy, eh? Besides we just won the gold in both Canadian men's hockey -tonight- and Canadian women's hockey !

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn_Sloanes
Reviews.Content: The room was adequately sized and well presented, especially the lovely ensuite. The staff were helpful when asked, although not overly friendly. The location was excellent with the hotel being right on the main street, really close to all everything of interest and just a few blocks from the CN tower.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and superb location”
Reviews.Author: susanVancouver09
Reviews.Content: I stayed over thr weekend and was VERY impressed with the quality of service(friendly staff) and the great room (really clean). I heard that they will be renovating in the near future and will make another reservation to see what the results are. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, good price, clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: helena_everywhere
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Good price, luggage room (SAFE!), friendly service. Only one little disapointment: the window on the room could not be opened. Next time in Toronto... Hotel Victoria!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent everything!”
Reviews.Author: lucrezia09
Reviews.Content: Stylish Hotel! Excellent staff and location! We arrived from Montreal, by train and the train station is 5min walking distance from Hotel Victoria! At 5min walking distance, left-hand side, the big shopping centre "Eaton Centre". Located in the fascinating financial district, it is closed to all major attractions such as CN Tower, Water front Harbour and many many others! Highly reccomanded the "Rich Tree" Market Restaurant ... 2min walking distance, right-hand side!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: klpringleo
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for one night and had several disappointments during our visit. We arrived early and though we could not yet check in, the staff told us they could hold our bags for us. Our bags were placed in an unsecure hallway accessable to anyone who came in so we made sure to ask that our bags would indeed be locked in a room. We were told not to worry, the bags would be locked up. However, when we returned the bags were in the exact same place and the staff did not seem to care less about our concern over the security of our luggage. Following our very unfriendly check in, we proceeded to our room which was absolutely disgusting. There were stains all over the carpet (I would not have taken my shoes off), dust accumulated all along the floorboards, some dirt on the bed sheets, marks on the walls and a very disgusting looking stain right in the centre of the armchair. The room had clearly been serviced but was still just absolutely filthy with stuck on dirt and stains and should not have been given out to any guest until major rennovations were done. After complaining to the staff we were given another room. When we complained the staff was very uncaring and not very apologetic. The new room was much better and obviously in a rennovated section of the hotel. If you are staying at this hotel, I would definately recommend asking if the room has been recently rennovated as there was a huge difference in these two rooms. Or if you aren't satisfied with your room, be sure to let them know! The hotel was is in a great location (though there are several other hotels in this area!) and at least we were given a new room which was nice and clean. However after seeing the first room and dealing with staff who do not seem to care about the fact that you are giving them business neither of us will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fleabag motel would have been better than this place!”
Reviews.Author: jaggerhoch
Reviews.Content: This is the letter we sent to them detailing our trip. We haven't gotten any reply or acknowledgement To Whom It May Concern. . . I wanted to write this email to you as soon as we returned home to inform you of the horrible experience that myself and my husband had at your hotel over the past three days. We arrived Thursday afternoon to a very rude man behind the reception desk. He didn't offer to help us with the bags, told us nothing about the amenities or services of the hotel. My husband unloaded the car about a block away and drove to find parking while I carried both of our bags and additional items about a block to the lobby. I tried to get the attention of the man at the reception desk, and when he didn't help me with the bags, I literally had to ask a stranger on the street to help me open the door and carry our things. After packing everything into the elevator while my husband parked our car, I was very disappointed by the size of our room. It was so small and cheaply decorated it was insulting. We live in Rochester with in laws in Buffalo so we spend a lot of time traveling to Toronto for various events and wanted to try a more historic hotel. From your website and literature, I am significantly surprised by your lack of quality. The bed was only a few feet off of the ground and the headboard was scratched and looked like it was going to fall off of the wall. The chair that was at the desk had a broken back, one of the doors on the mirrored closet was off of the track and broken. These items, paired with a lovely view of an alleyway just made for a more insulting first experience. You should also be aware of some additional problems with the room and the service that we experienced during our stay. The shower was broken in multiple places - the plumbing into the shower head wasn't tightened correctly so one stream of water actually shot out over the top of the shower door onto the floor of the bathroom and the second sprout of water sprayed up to the lighting fixture in the ceiling. My husband was able to redirect the one stream of water, but the other still sprayed over the top of the shower door. My husband used the bathroom and thought there was a problem with the toilet when the tank continued to run, so he removed the top of the toilet tank and we COULD NOT BELIEVE WHAT WE SAW. Inside the toilet tank we found unopened bottles of wine coolers being stored in the toilet tank. I have no idea how long they were there, but the caps were rusted shut and the water was totally brown. I don't have to tell you how disgusting this is. We took pictures of the toilet tank, which I have attached. Throughout our stay there seemed to be a general disregard for guests by the staff. Friday night we were waiting for the elevator and two employees from the cleaning crew had large grey bins of towels and other laundry. They literally pushed past us to get into the elevator and said nothing. I HOPE i don't have to explain that this is not proper etiquette in a hotel setting or any setting. I also noticed a lot of signs about not smoking in the hotel and we stayed on the fourth floor and I can tell you that the people staying on our floor were certainly smoking. The hotel smelled horrible. I informed someone working at the front desk, which seemed very disinterested. Over our stay we informed various people at the front desk about our issues and not ONCE did anyone offer to repair anything, compensate us in anyway and when we checked out we again told the man at the front desk about our experience and he said he would inform the manager. He then thanked us for not yelling at him like other guests have in the past. So, since we got no satisfaction or compensation, I felt that I would put this in writing and send it along to you. We feel so insulted that this is the first thing that I have to do when returning from our weekend. As I said earlier, we travel to Toronto a lot and wanted to try a different hotel. We have stayed all over downtown and I promise you that: 1. We will NEVER stay at your hotel again 2. We WILL tell everyone who asks about our vacation exactly where we stayed and the experience that we had. I am also a corporate trainer who travels extensively and believe me, my employees and other trainers would love to know about this experience since they travel often. 3. Depending upon your response and your action thereafter, I will write a detailed online review which will articulate every single item that I discussed in this email as well as the pictures of the conditions. 4. I will also post this information on my blog as well as face book. I look forward to your immediate action and response. Room 403

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie_H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Victoria for 14 nights while on holiday in Toronto. I'd thoroughly recommend it. It's in a fantastic location within walking distance of most of the main sights and loads of great bars and restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was small but clean with a good sized bathroom. It was located at the back of the hotel which meant it was very quiet. A room facing Yonge Street might have been more noisy. A flat screen TV with a good selection of channels was a bonus! I'd recommend heading to the St Lawrence district (about 2 minutes away) to find cafes, bars and restaurants rather than heading up to more touristy places on Yonge Street. We asked the hotel about tours to Niagara and were recommended to use Niagara VIP tours. Our guide was friendly and knowledgable but if you do choose this option please bear in mind that you will be travelling in a mini-bus/van rather than a coach, which was very cramped and not what I would class as VIP! We didn't realise until afterwards that there are loads of different tour companies out there offering a variety of packages, so shop around. You should also be aware that a 15% tip is 'expected', plus tax, which made the trip more expensive than we anticipated. All in all we had a great time in Tornonto and we were very pleased we had chosen to stay at the Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great; Erskin at the front desk is awesome”
Reviews.Author: caleb05
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights while attending a convention at another hotel nearby. We chose this hotel because of location, price, and other travelers' reviews. We had read that our room would be small and this was my only concern prior to check-in. It was not nearly as small as some "reviewers" had posted. The room was very clean, fully functional, with easy to access internet. Erskin at the front desk was extremely polite, professional, helpful and most of all.....fun. We enjoyed our stay immensely and the only drawback was the length of time it took the hot water to reach the shower on the 8th (top) floor. But who cares about that? One never gets in until the water is the right temperature anyway! I would GLADLY stay there again when returning to Toronto. Location was just GREAT. (I have been in the hotel industry for 17 years...and am VERY picky.) Try it. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: cicamica
Reviews.Content: Nothing to write home about this hotel. Non characteristic, standard room with good size bed and en-suite bathroom. Fairly clean and in good nick apart from the peeling wall paper which is cello-taped together and looks hilarious. It's ok for one night if you want to catch a train early in the morning since its convenient location to Union St but for longer stay I would probably choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very average hotel for everything else”
Reviews.Author: middymagic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in June 2009. It is centrally located but very basic. No air conditioning or fan and our room looked out on to some bins at the back and was close to anothe building so the room was very dark all the time. The hotel is ok if you are out fight seeing all the time but not if you wish to stay in the room apart from sleeping. There is also no parking at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JuneKent_England
Reviews.Content: Great service, helpful before our stay, answering any questions and putting themselves out to give you the best advice on trips and some honest recommendations on tours. Great location, small but charming but this gave them the opportunity for great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: juneroma2008
Reviews.Content: Aside from a run down roadside motel I stayed in once in Sault Ste. Marie, this was the worst hotel I have ever been in. I read all the reviews before booking and probably focused on the positive ones, but looking over them again today, the negatives are much closer to the truth. Dirty lobby, uncaring staff. No parking and no attempt to help find any nearby. We had no hot water and very, very low water pressure. A call to the front desk, and we were informed that it takes about 15 minutes to warm up. No kidding. So while eventually it did warm up, the water pressure was little more than a trickle. I don't care how central or cheap it is, I need a hotel to be clean and have hot water. Best to find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our trip”
Reviews.Author: Mates Family
Reviews.Content: We did a 3 night stopover in Toronto and booked the Victoria for its location mainly but also the price seemed reasonable. Location was perfect as its within 5 minutes walk of all the attractions, shops & restuarants that you want to see during a stopover. Its also easy to pick up a car and drive to Niagara as we did. Hotel lobby is small and a little dated but the staff were very helpful and happy to recommend good restuarants for us. Room we had was much bigger than expected and clean and comfortable. Generally the hotel is small but has a lot of character due to its age (2nd oldest in Toronto apparently). We didn't use the restuarant but there's a good deli opposite and plenty of good restuarants close by. If your in Toronto for a few days, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Roll out of bed and right to the Hockey Hall of Fame, BUT NO PARKING ON THE GROUNDS”
Reviews.Author: papaae39
Reviews.Content: My wife chose this place based on its location and price based on what was available for our trip. I have to admit you can't beat the location, if you care about hockey they way we do and it was our main purpose for the trip than this place is perfect for you. I would say that it had some drawbacks, the outside of the building looked nice however the inside lobby and general check in area just seemed old. The elevator seemed old but these are minor details. It did however set the mood for the rest of the stay, you could tell it was an old apartment building converted into a hotel. The room we had on the 3rd floor was TINY, walked right into the bed and desk. The bathroom was a decent size and probably the saving grace. It was the only thing modernized in the hotel room. The place had the feel of the national lampoons European vacation to it and the first thing I said was I felt like it was a hotel the Griswalds stayed at. BIG negative to me was the fact that we had to use the public parking around the block, which wouldn't have been bad except that there were a lot of beggars and it wasn't a good idea to show luggage or a touristy look coming from the garage. It got the job done, the bed was confortable and it had a TV, it was perfect for a rest when you wanted to just stop for a bit but then go right back to what you were doing around town. There seemed to be a great night life around the hotel. It grew on me after a night or so and I would stay there again but just don't expect a cushy modernized place it was cozy..

Reviews.Title: “Good Value & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: buzzinlites
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction while we stayed here. It was no frills & a small room. The only complaint was the shower curtain had a smell to it. We got that changed and everything else at the hotel was clean. The location was within walking distance to most of the city sites. For those cost of the room per night and it cleanliness, it is definitely worth considering if you are visiting Toronto, especially if are on a smaller budget. One thing to keep in mind is that parking is at the closest public parking facility, a few blocks away. The hotel has no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value,great location”
Reviews.Author: holyrood55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Victoria for one night while attending an event at the Air Canada Centre. While the lobby of the hotel is a bit shabby, (especially by the elevator) the room was very clean and well worth the money. The bathroom was very modern and well put together. There were plenty of towels and they provided 3 of everything (shampoos, lotions etc) which I thought was a nice touch since there were three of us staying in the room. We were in the deluxe suite for $125.00/night with two queen beds. Our room faced on to Yonge St. My daughter found it a bit noisy but I felt that that is to be expected when staying in downtown Toronto.The beds were fairly comfortable and there were extra blankets in the dresser drawer. The desk attendant was very helpful (morning and evening) I used the gym down the street. I have a membership at Exclusively Womens in Waterloo which is affiliated with Goodlife. They accepted my membership card no problem . The gym was excellent,showers,lockers ,lots of towels, razors, mouthwash,etc all the extras. We parked in the first parking lot we came to when we drove down The Espanade. It was less than three blocks from the hotel. It cost $15.00 to park there from 7:00 pm to 5:00 pm the next day which is quite reasonable for downtown Toronto. We had breakfast in Over Easy downstairs. Again good prices,and good service. No complaints. There are lots of good restaurants within one block of the hotel. All in all good value for the location and convenience to public transit and the Gardiner alone. We will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Right in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: tubalusa
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Toronto and I didn't really know where I am going and what to look for. I picked Hotel Victoria because of price and on the map it seemed close to Downtown. I was shocked when I discovered that I was paying little bit over $100 for a Hotel which located right in Downtown on the best street in Toronto. I didn't expect that it will be so close to everything. Service was amazing! I don't remember name of the waiter in the restaurant but this man used to live in Boston before "big dig" and we spend almost an hour talking about Canada, New England, and Boston. He was extremely polite, friendly, and great as a person. Other stuff was polite and friendly as well. People who worked there was giving me a lot of information about Toronto, they helped whith everything I asked. By the way, food was amazing and it cost me les than ten bucks all the time. The have a real restaurant with discount prices for those who stay in th hotel. I stayed in Victoria hotel for almost a week and I went to eat somewhere else only once. Moreover, I booked my room for 3 days but decided to stay longer. Hotel stuff told me that my room was already booked after me... to fix this issue hey gave me apology and moved me to better room with more space and bigger bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: bracmah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Victoria on March 3rd for one night. We usually stay at the Westin Harbour Caste, but decided to give this hotel a try. I will definitely stay there again. The rooms are small not luxurious, but exceedingly clean, the bathroom was very functional and very clean. This hotel has recently been refurbished. Am not sure what designer came up with the finished result of lovely beige and gold in bedroom and bathroom, and ugly grey laminate flooring. The only thing I could find wrong with the room was the bathroom wallpaper, whoever hung it forgot to size the walls first and it is in need of attention. However it is a great hotel to stay at, a great location, within walking distance of everything we wanted to do. This hotel did remind me of the boutique hotels we stayed at in Paris. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dwme1
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a central location in downtown Toronto I would suggest looking elsewhere. For the $100 US that I paid the floor was dirty and the hot water in the shower literally took 10 minutes to kick in. The downstairs lobby was also not tidy. When I check out the attendant asked how my stay was and I said, "mixed"....well, he either didn't hear me or chose not to respond because there was no follow up. The good thing is that I did arrive hours early and the attendant at that time was kind enough to let me check my bags while I wondered around, and when I arrived back about a half hour before check in he let me check in early. The room was noise free with the exception of the occasional subway running nearby. I guess I was also disappointed after searching around so much and spending the amount of money I did on a place that elsewhere would have gone for alot less.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: blackbear701
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at the Hotel Victoria with a girlfriend. I can heartily recommend this hotel for a number of reasons: you cannot beat the location, as it is within walking distance of everything we wanted to do; the room was spotlessly clean, and the queen-size beds were super-comfortable, which made for a very good night's sleep. I found the hotel to be very reasonably priced and an excellent value for the money. The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating, at one point spending a fair amount of time to look up something for us on the internet. When I return to Toronto for another visit, I will definitely stay at this little gem of a hotel. An added plus: it is just down the block from Richtree Market Restaurant; grab a 10% off coupon at the front desk of the hotel, and get ready for a beautiful dining experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: happyoldtravellers
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in process of being redecorated and claims to be a boutique hotel, although it doesn't quite live up to that label yet. Its location is brilliant in downtown Toronto. It has no restaurant, but that doesn't matter as there is a wealth of them locally. The entrance and lobby are being done up, so at present it is rather faded, dusty and dull, but the room was good. Although compact, and with no view to speak of (that didn't matter either as we were out all day doing the tourist thing) it served our purposes well. The attempt to modernise it has not quite succeeded; whoever redesigned it or created the decor misfired slightly. Lovely state-of-the art bathroom fittings were poorly placed, with very little attention to practicality, so that there was virtually no place to put our stuff (although there was the room) and you couldn't help but splash water over the place! This is just not going to stand up to constant use! The decor was modern and pleasant, but the greyish wood laminate flooring wasn't able to match with anything else in the room! That said, it still had some ambiance and was certainly clean and comfortable. We did feel that in its present state of redecoration it was overpriced, especially compared to other hotels we had stayed in in the area (although they weren't right in the middle of town!)

Reviews.Title: “great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: SydneySally
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Victoria. The hotel has been renovated, the rooms are really clean but small. The value for money however is great. You certainly get more then you pay for. No complaints. The location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: apb0229
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 10yo son on holiday in Toronto. I thought it superb value for the money - comfortable, friendly, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: Pilot7700
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Victoria was very close to the downtown attractions. The check-in clerk was very rude and had a very bad attitude. The lobby was small and was in need of face lift. It was very dark and dingy. The rooms, although very clean and decorated very well, were extremely small, as was the bathroom. I felt like I had booked a closet to sleep in. We checked out extremely early because the room had no place to sit other than on the bed. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: summerholiday_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Right in the middle of downtown Toronto. The staff were really helpful. The rates were very good. They stored our bags at no extra cost as we had to book out early but the flight was late. Excellent eating places within easy walking distance. Exactly what we wanted as a base to explore Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: wellookiehere
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria is great as a base from which to see the city. It's on Yonge Street, bonus, and is reasonably priced. Things like CN Tower, Rogers Centre/Skydome, the Eaton Centre, harbourfront, Hockey Hall of Fame, Union station and Dundas Square are all between 5 and 20 minutes' walk. A list of good food options in the area would have the 'Richtree market restaurant' at the top (it's also one of the closest), nice 'takesushi' place around the corner, Baton Rouge closer to Dundas square. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. You don't choose hotel victoria because you want luxury, nice thick walls that block out most noise, or a view of anything but a brick wall (in our room anyway), but like i said it has friendly staff, is reasonably priced and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdaDublin
Reviews.Content: This a lovely hotel. We stayed for four nights in August and although the area was a little quiet, the hotel itself was fantastic. The room, although small, was extremely comfortable, with very warm decor. The bathroom was great too. Would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Very nice rooms at very competitive rates”
Reviews.Author: Casina_di_Rosa
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in Yong Street. Amazing location, too bad it does not have its own parking spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: hisankles
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Victoria is the best hotel I have come across. My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights in July. The hotel is located right in the heart of downtown Toronto and is next to everything. We parked the car (which is the only downfall) in a parking lot and only needed it to go to the Zoo. The staff at the front desk were the nicest people and the other staff held the doors and elevators for us on many occasions. The room was very clean and the view was stunning. The TV had many channels and the mini fridge was a great add on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will be going back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, satisfied completely”
Reviews.Author: TuscanSun841
Reviews.Content: I got myself all worried about staying here after reading some negative reviews. However, our experience was perfect. The hotel is in a great location when you are walking around Toronto. I understand that there is no parking here, so if you brought your car you would have the added complication of finding and paying for public parking, which the hotel staff will help you with. We walked into the lobby and it was nothing fancy- but there was also nothing wrong with it. Same with the elevator and the hallway. We opened our door and walked into our room. It is a very small room! But it honestly looks nice and is well appointed. It has nice lighting, a nice big mirror, a nice tv, everything is nice. There is nothing to find that made me think that the room was dirty or outdated. It was maybe not the fancy hotel room that I have been used to, but it certainly was NOT shabby. It was great. There is no entraceway when you enter your room, you are directly in the small room as soon as you walk in and it has wall-to-wall light beige carpeting. Our carpet was clean- maybe not perfectly perfectly clean but there were no big stains or anything. I was thinking that because you walk into your room in your shoes that some of the rooms may have stains on the carpet near the door. Ours was fine though. It's no big deal really. I have read before that the street noise is noisy at this hotel. We stayed in room 206 and this was not the case! Quite the opposite! We couldn't hear a THING all night from the street AT ALL. There was even a thunderstorm and we couldn't hear it over our TV and the fan noise of our air conditioner. Walls may be a little thin- it was hard to tell because we had very quiet neighbours but it seemed like noisy neighbours would be very easy to hear through the wall based on the noises that I did hear. Bathroom is perfectly nice- like I said, not the same quality that you find at a luxury hotel but it is nicely appointed and it was clean.Our total after taxes was $146 for a queen size bed. We were happy to save so much money, get a great location, and end up with zero complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: prasenberg
Reviews.Content: For my first time in Toronto I picked this hotel on Yonge Street, based on the reviews on this website. It was a great experience. The location is great. Close to Union Station, close to the subway, lots of shops and stores close-by. Right in the middle of town. The room I got was spacious, a great bathroom (finally a shower with some nice pressure!), really fast, stable and free (!) wireless internet., large bed, some room to put my stuff, coffee machine etc. Staff was friendly. My room was located on the side of Yonge Street. That was a bit noisy. I actually like that (sound of a big city!), but if that's a problem for you, you might want to ask for a quieter room. Next time I'm in Toronto, I will look no further to find a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: fatboytom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. A wonderful place, for a great price the service was as good as that in other more expensive hotels. Staff at front desk were friendly and always helpful, no matter what time of the day. Rooms are a little small, but nicely decorated and more than adequate for what you pay and need. Free Wi-Fi is great, as is the resturant downstairs. Hotel is located closely to the Subway and Streetcars. Will defiently stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel, Good Location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Shuz712
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early Feb 2008. Its a great budget hotel in a good location. Nice and close to the street cars, and ttc, we found some great places to eat close by. There is a great cafe around the corner that had free internet access when you bought breakfast. The staff were cheerful and helpful, inparticular the afternoon staff . The room was small but very clean and had everything we needed in it for a six night stay. Would happily recommend this hotel for travellers not looking for the chain experience in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value and Location Near ACC”
Reviews.Author: LafPies
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I just got back from a wonderful weekend in Toronto. We picked Hotel Victoria because it was less than 5 minutes walking distance to the ACC and other attractions that we wanted to go to. Also, Expedia had a 'web special' rate on the hotel for $105 + tax. The Hotel itself and our room, were very clean, and the frontdesk staff were helpful and offered us an early check-in. Parking for the hotel was not included, but very close by in Commerce Court on Wellington St. For approx 28 hours, our parking fee was $24.00, which was reasonable. We also ate at "Over Easy" the adjoining all-day breakfast restaurant. The restaurant was very clean and bright, and the food was fresh and homemade. If you're looking for good value (by Toronto standards) on a night's stay with lots of nearby amenities, and nothing luxurious, this is an excellent pick.

Reviews.Title: “Walked out after seeing the rooms”
Reviews.Author: markasaurus
Reviews.Content: We read good reviews on this website and thought the location was convenient since it's a few blocks from the train station. Upon seeing the front of the building, we were worried. It looked run down, and upon entering the lobby looked even worse. Pipes with insulation hanging off them came out of the ceiling, and everything needed a coat of paint. We got the key to our room and went up in the elevator. The room wasn't completely uninhabitable, but for $130 a night I was expecting something better than a flophouse. Most of the furnishings looked ancient, the rug was obviously old and not clean, and the room was an odd shape and also very dark. The only window looked into a brick air shaft. We went to the desk to complain, and they explained that there weren't that many other rooms in our price range. We got the keys to a more recently renovated room on the 2nd floor, but it wasn't much better. The light-colored rug was almost black in front of the door and the room was tiny. The window was about 5 feet about the floor with a through-the-wall air conditioner below it. We checked out and found a room at the Day's Inn Hotel next to the old Maple Leaf Gardens. It was quite a bit cheaper and MUCH nicer. It even had a view. Don't stay at the Hotel Victoria, you will regret it. There are much better bargains around Toronto if you look.

Reviews.Title: “Yonge St. - great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: smooterbuffaloNY
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming - I was disappointed at first by the ordinary, plain decor, but the room was very clean and the hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The restaurant, that can be accessed through the hotel lobby, is open until 4 p.m. It serves breakfast all day long but has a great variety of food available. It's called Over Easy, and it's easy to spot the hotel from the street because of its sign. The food was excellent. Hotel Victoria is located conveniently near the King St. subway stop and close to Front Street, the Hockey Hall of Fame, the train station, the waterfront. It's two stops on the subway to the Eaton Centre but a pleasant walk in good weather. A bar and restaurant, called the Irish Embassy, is directly across Yonge St. My room, which faced a back alley, was noisy the first night. I could hear dishes banging from a nearby restaurant (?), but I realized that I was staying in the downtown area of a large city! I never heard anyone in adjoining rooms or in the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but no wow factor or friendliness”
Reviews.Author: Cosmona
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in September. Location wise this is an excellent hotel. But I hestitate using the word hotel. It doesn't have a bar or internet access available unless you have your own laptop and they are still using dial up - which you have to pay for. I can't say the guys behind the desk were the most helpful or friendly people. We chose this hotel because of its location which was great - very close to everything. Just don't expect this to be a friendly place - it aint. There is no restaurant in the hotel you have access to a restaurant which is in the building. They were very nice staff there. THis hotel was the first place in I stayed in Canada. I have to say the service got better as i moved on to my next destination. One thing that really irked me was that i suffer from asthma and the room we were in hadn't been dusted in quite a while. I had to ask them to dust after 2 days as i was awake all night coughing. After that i didn't have to use my inhaler for the rest of my holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: MAT07_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the centrally located hotel for 3 nights. Found it to be a good price. Room was clean and spacious as was bathroom. We had breakfast in the attached diner Overeasy - their fruit salad with yoghurt and granola was delicious! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Practical”
Reviews.Author: ast66
Reviews.Content: Hotel Victoria's location is very convenient, probably the best feature of the hotel. We stayed one night (for a concert) and the room was sensible and tasteful, although smaller than your typical chain hotels. The bathroom was spacious and well decorated in comparison to the bedroom itself. I felt that the room rate was extremely fair. Furthermore, I like to support local business; the hotel is locally owned and maintained. For good eats, try out Richtree's market...it's a block away and the food is delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: Barleycove
Reviews.Content: Friends travelling together booked three rooms at Hotel Victoria for the first weekend in June. This was at the time of the Luminato festival and there was a lot happening in the city. We wanted to be downtown and pay a reasonable price. We were very pleased with our stay. The rooms were basic but clean and comfortable. The front desk staff were extremely helpful. The location is excellent- we were able to walk most places but it is also very close to the subway. We had one lunch and one breakfast at the restaurant by the hotel and were satisfied with the food and prices. There are many restaurants in the neighbourhood, so visitors can easily choose what they want. It was a positive experience and we would recommend Hotel Victoria for location and value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: jackie425
Reviews.Content: I feel the opposite in regards to the last review. I was very impressed with Hotel Victoria for the price. The hotel is in an excellent location in the city. Yes, the room was small, but very clean (bathroom, bed, carpet). Our bathroom had new large tile on the floor and in the shower. The sink and toilet appeared to be new also. We had an inner room with no view, but it was quiet. Besides, we werenâ€™t in our room much; there is so much to see in Toronto. The room was more than adequate. Also, the staff member that was working Saturday and Sunday (05/26-27) evening was very helpful in helping us select a restaurant. I recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great - Hotel Not”
Reviews.Author: Chloegone
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2-night stay at Hotel Victoria. My husband travels for business and a tag along. Great location - hotel not great! Small, old and run down. Our room faced Yonge Street and was very nosiy. Wooden shutters, no drapes, did not keep out the lights from the street. The carpet was so filthy that we felt compelled to wear shoes to walk on it. The bedspread was stained. The elevator very slow. The bathroom was clean except for the /bathtub/shower walls. Luckily, the weather was pleasant. Otherwise, the wall air conditioner would not have been sufficient to cool the room. The staff apparently knew nothing about the city and did not understand English. When asked for directions to catch the brightly-colored sightseeing buses, she appeared clueless. I went to the staff at another hotel and was given specific directions. When asked about places to eat dinner, they were not entirely sure which way to point. There is a cafe downstairs. However, $12 for cereal, milk and a muffin seemed expensive. Walk one block to Richtree and eat a full breakfast or whatever you want for less money. Try the PATH, the underground mall, for everything you would ever need. This hotel was booked for us by someone else. We will be returning to Toronto in a couple of weeks and will definitely not be staying at the Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Kay_Billcar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its proximity to the train station - about a 5-minute walk. Our twin room was small and badly lit. There was no ceiling light and the wall and desk lights weren't at all adequate. On the plus side, the bathroom was spacious and had nice fittings. All that could be seen out the window was a high brick wall. The advantage of being at the back of the hotel, of course, was that the room was quiet. The hotel has no restaurant facilities of its own - a door from the lobby leads into a non-affiliated place that serves breakfast and lunch. We were told that it was a bit overpriced, so we tried a deli/restaurant at the end of Yonge Street for a cooked breakfast. If you want a lighter breakfast 'to go', you can walk to a small Tim Hortons on one of the side streets. Since the hotel is on busy Yonge Street, there are plenty of eateries within a short walking distance. We spent one night there, and wouldn't have liked to have been based there for all our time in Toronto. The room just wasn't nice enough. But people who want to stay right in the city centre and who reckon that 'all you need is a bed' probably won't find a better-value place than the Hotel Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Only for business”
Reviews.Author: JHE
Reviews.Content: Just a short version, upside for this hotel, Location great in the middle of everything, Free wireless connection, Room Ok. Downside, only 1 very slov elevator, room very small, no restaurant after 7 PM, This is ok for a short business stay if the only thing yoy need is a good located hotel with ok rooms and a wireless connection, but dont bring family or your partner its not really a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: foxradio
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in the downtown area for a weekend getaway, when we were referred to the Hotel Victoria by a family friend.. After a quick and effortless booking, we anticipated our weekend in Toronto. Upon arrival we found the staff to be friendly and our room and the hotel in general was better then expected. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable and appears to have been recently remodeled. I appreciated the wireless internet connection to keep on top of my email. The hotel is close to many of Toronto's attractions and if you are like us you will enjoy the short walk to the local restaurants and shopping locations. We would certainly recommend the hotel based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jez&Carly
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the Hotel Victoria in Toronto so we probably cant comment too much on the hotel and its facilities. The Hotel Victoria is in a good location right in the centre of things on Yonge Street. There is also a great Irish bar right across the road. Our room was small and a bit old which was not a problem for us as we were only there for a short stay. The room was clean which was the main thing.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Victoria, It's all about location.”
Reviews.Author: 68amx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Victoria is perfectly located on Yonge Street, one half block from a subway station, ten minutes walk from Union Station, and within walking distance of the best Toronto has to offer. If you are looking for more than location, however, you will be disappointed. The clean, comfortable rooms are small, (approx. fifteen feet square with ten foot ceilings) with an adequate bathroom. There is only one small elevator. We paid approximately $375 for three nights, with an additional $47 to park our car in a nearby garage. If you are into pools and spas and pampering or are traveling with children, this is definitely not what you're looking for. If, however, your goal is to blend into the city and explore, you'll be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Best location Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Toronto and stayed at the Hotel Victoria on Yonge Street from June 11th-June 15th. I was hesitant at first because of the other reviews posted but from past experience I decided to go with my gut, and with what Frommers had recommended. I made the reservation online and received a prompt response. About a week before we left I emailed them and asked to ensure we received a non-smoking room. I just didn't want to take any chances and all was perfect upon arrival. We checked in about one hour ahead of schedule which was nice b/c we wanted to get out and about asap. The staff behind the reception desk seemed to change often which we found amusing. They were all pleasant, not overly, but pleasant and easy to deal with. As indicated in other reviews, the room was small but clean, and this was more important to me. Clean is a must. The bathroom was quaint and our view was, well, a brick wall but we spent very little time in the hotel room so we weren't worried. The temperature rose as the week went on and the air conditioning worked well. Each day we returned to find our room spotless. The one drawback was the lack of a munchie machine in the hotel. This sounds silly I know but when Game 5 of the Stanley Cup is on you need your munchies. There was a pop machine and ice machine in the basement though. Next door to the hotel was a little newstand/convenience store. We only noticed it on day 3 or so and wish we had found it earlier. It was called International News. The woman there was so nice and welcoming and very chatty. It was great. She asked where we were from and where we were going, etc. This was a great place to grab snacks to sneak into the Jays game. The only problem is it closed around 7pm, but that's ok. The woman there made up for it. This hotel is all about location, location, location. It was about a 5 min walk from the Eatons Centre. Yonge Street is incredible, full of shopping and restaurants. I highly recommend Eggspectations just up the road and Shopsy's across the street. Yum. It was also practically right next door to the Hockey Hall of Fame. This made it easy to run around, come back and rest a minute, and then keep exploring. The one thing I really liked about Hotel Victoria is that they were not all gushy over us. We would come and go, they would say hello, and that was about it. The night before we checked out I was stressing b/c our flight was only at 8pm and the thought of dragging our luggage around terrified me. I asked the girl at the desk (I think her name was Carla?) if they would keep our luggage after check out for the day and she said it was no problem and it would be locked up until we returned. Fantastic. This was a big help and a huge relief. One more thing...we never heard a sound from the other rooms or even in the hallways. If you want a pool, a fabulous in house restaurant, and lots of room....do not go here but if you want good value in a great downtown location then this is the place for you. And I'm picky so trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I asked for a non-smoking room and booked it several days in advance and was told no problem. I arrived late at night after driving many hours on business and was completely exhausted and too tired unfortunately to complain that night when I walked into what was definitely a room used for smoking. There were many cigarette burns in the carpet, the toilet seat had a chip in it (talk about bacteria growth) and even the handle to flush the toilet was broken. When I tried to at least turn on the fan to help get rid of the cigarette smoke, it didn't work at all nor did the air conditioner. The window was open when I had arrived so I guess that was their idea for cooler air. I convinced myself to just go to sleep as I had a big day the next day and it was only for one night. Unfortunately it was difficult to ignore the smell of cigarettes even in the sheets. When I complained the next morning that I had asked for a non-smoking room, the lady said "we can try to get one but cannot guarantee them as they are reserved for people with allergies and asthma only." I told her I would in future lie that I suffered from these just to have a non-smoking room in the future. How rediculous is that? I will never stay there again. Perhaps they could use my $138 for the one night and fix the chipped toilet seat at least.

Reviews.Title: “It's All About The Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November of 2005. The Hotel was still under renovations, and the rooms are small, but if you are used to staying in European hotels this one will seem large. It was clean and the hotel staff was helpfull and gave us loads of directions and shortcuts around town. The location if fabulous, blocks from BCE place, The waterfront, Eaton Centre and the subway. It's half a block from Marche that is an open market concept restaurant that is delicious and will satisfy everyone. We are going back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Victoria in September 2005. After booking a room with continental breakfast, we were told the that there was no breakfast because the dining room was closed for renovation and unless we could prove in writing we were promised such, ther would be none.. After much arguement with the manager we were finally given breakfast passes to a resaurant nearby. When we got to the room the carpet was filthy. In the night they were working on the building next door drilling holes in the concrete until 11:30 pm and the work began again the next morning at 7am. After discussions with the staff it turned this work had been going on on and off for months. During all of this the manager was very dificult to deal with and we couldn't find another hotel because the film festival was that week. After much discussion with the manager we were finally moved on the third day to a room that was away from the noise but was just as dirty as the first. After the all discussions they finally did reduce our room rate to that of thier smallest room. Small consellation for not being able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, I'm returning for a second stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A couple of years ago, I stayed here for the first time for one or two nights. It was by far the best-value mid-range accomodation I've stayed in in Toronto, because it's downtown, close to the train station and comfortable. I've travelled the world and have stayed in a wide range of accomodations, and the room where I stayed in the Hotel Victoria stands out in my memory for its cushy bed and nice bathroom. Other places I've stayed in the city were overpriced and far-flung, or merely far-flung and cheap but not worth it. Since I'll be travelling by rail between Montreal and Windsor, I've decided to give the Hotel Victoria another go.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Victoria
HotelInfo.Address: 56 Yonge St., Toronto, Ontario M5E 1G5, Canada
